WorkItem.ClosedComment: Verified this works as expected in the 0.9.5 release.
WorkItem.Description:
I'm using the latest LKG for 0.9 at this time (2ac536f6429c810e176d66997182a2b1cde2fb53).

Typescript compiler is generating ANSI files even though the source code is UTF-8.

This is making it really complicated to have strings for non-english languages.

Typescript compiler should generate UTF-8 by default, or use an specified encoding for both source and output files.

Comments.Message: Thanks.  We're aware of this issue and working to fix it.  We'll keep this bug open for tracking.

Sorry, which ticket is being tracked? The link provided points to this same issue.

I'd like to track it because I stopped testing 0.9 because of this as any code I work required UTF-8.

This problem also applies to tsc 0.8.3.1. Tested it on Windows and Linux, no UTF-8. It would be great if there was at least a command line flag for utf8.

Tanks!

We're actually tracking this work as part of https://typescript.codeplex.com/workitem/1007, which is closely related .  Closing this newer report as a duplicate.  When the earlier bug is resolved, this issue will be addressed.  Thanks!
